docblock.long-description: Contract to which all database drivers should conform
Connect to the database
Kill the connection to the database
Prepare a query statement
Bind the value of a referenced variable to a placeholder in the prepared query
Execute a prepared query
Begin a transaction
Commit all executions made in the current transaction
Rollback all executions made in the current transaction

Return an associative array of the next row in the result set

[
    $column1 => $value1,
    $column2 => $value2
]
Return a stdClass object of the next row in the result set

Return a multi-deminesional array of all rows from the result set

[
    0 => [
        $column1 => $value1,
        $column2 => $value2
    ],
    1 => [
        $column1 => $value1,
        $column2 => $value2
    ]
]

A database abstraction for PHP OCI8 functionality.

Note: It is recommended, for performance improvements, to set the oci8.default_prefetch option in your php.ini. This will significantly improve network performance as it will reduce the number of round trips on the network by buffering rows into the SLQ*Net transport cache.
Checks if executions should be auto commited
A database abstraction for PHP PDO driver
Object to handle calls to database driver objects, provides an interface to write ANSI/ISO SQL without object oriented query building with support for transactions.
A Dependency Injection Container.
Provide configuration for the container instance
Register a class name, closure or fully configured item with the container, we will handle dependencies at the time it is requested
Check if an alias is registered with the container
Resolve and return the requested item
Builds an object and injects constructor arguments

Recursively resolve dependencies, and dependencies of dependencies etc.. etc.. Will first check if the parameters type hint is instantiable and resolve that, if not it will attempt to resolve an implementation from the param annotation
Accepts an object in string or object form and returns an array of param matches from the constructor doc block

docblock.long-description: A collection of route and hook event objects

property.name: $routes
property.default: array('ANY' => array(), 'GET' => array(), 'POST' => array(), 'PUT' => array(), 'PATCH' => array(), 'DELETE' => array(), 'OPTIONS' => array())

property.name: $hooks
property.default: array('before' => array('ANY' => array(), 'GET' => array(), 'POST' => array(), 'PUT' => array(), 'PATCH' => array(), 'DELETE' => array(), 'OPTIONS' => array()), 'after' => array('ANY' => array(), 'GET' => array(), 'POST' => array(), 'PUT' => array(), 'PATCH' => array(), 'DELETE' => array(), 'OPTIONS' => array()))
